result.execSummary:
The defendant Josie M Simmonds was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other senence.  Huber privileges for work and treatment.

miscConds.notes:
$500.00 which has already been paid.   Any other restitution to be determined at a later date.

**11-26-14/ William S. Pocan**
Court ordered additional restitution in the amount of $3,126.82, to Integrity Insurance Company and payable as a condition of Probation.  Failure to pay results in a civl judgment.
Pay all costs and surcharges within term of probation.  If not paid, civil  judgment to be entered.  Court waived the mandatory DNA surcharge due to the fact that no DNA sample will be taken.
Seek and maintain full time employment.
No illegal drugs. No controlled substances without valid prescription.  No contact with drug community or Veronica G.

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a misdmeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.   Upon successful completion  of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.  Must submit letter from agent.

Cognitive behavior therapy. 
Attend anger management classes if not already done.
Alcohol and drug assessment and mental health assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Josie M Simmonds

records.addlTxt: Per request of the State Public Defender's Office.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Amended JOC reflects 11-26-14 Court order for additional restitution

Defendant Josie M Simmonds in court with attorney Jeffrey Jensen for attorneyJohn Scott Schiro.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties stipulate to additional restitution in the amount of $3,126.82 owed to Integrity Insurance Company and payable as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.  Judgment of conviction to be amended accordingly.

As to Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  
  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Court ordered restitution in the amount of $500.00 which has already been paid.  Any other restitution to be determined at a later date.

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 2
days time served, Huber privileges for work and treatment.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 1 year with the following conditions:
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and mental health assessment; comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.  Attend Anger Management classes if not already done.
*No contact with Veronica G.

- Pay all costs and surcharges within term of probation, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
-Court waived the mandatory DNA surcharge due to the fact that no DNA sample will be taken.

Appeal rights given.  Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.  Must submit letter from agent.

Defendant Josie M Simmonds in court with attorney John Scott Schiro and attorney Corey Mehlos.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Criminal Damage to Property (Less than $2,500.00 Damage), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.01(1), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Status conference scheduled for November 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Josie M Simmonds in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Josie M Simmonds in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant will continue to pay toward restitution and is ordered continued compliance with JPoint.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2014, this case will be assigned to:  Judge POCAN, Branch 26, in ROOM 634 of the COURTHOUSE.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  kmw

Defendant Josie M Simmonds in court with attorney John S Schiro.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk Defene requested time to allow defendant to satisfy restitution.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 34.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  kmw
Defendant reminded to have no contact with Veronica G and Zablocki Elementary School.

Defendant Josie M Simmonds in court with attorney Lucas Kaster for John S Schiro.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with VERONICA G. AND ZABLOCKI ELEMENTARY SCHOOL.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Josie M Simmonds in court with attorney Kristen N Nelson.  Defendant Josie M Simmonds in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge YAMAHIRO, Branch 34.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
